citations.narrative:
There is a 6 foot perimeter fence around the porcupine enclosure except for the area of the gate. The existing gate is less
than 6 feet in height. Lack of a complete 6 foot high perimeter fence does not prevent unauthorized people or unwanted
animals from having access to the animals housed within. Also lack of a complete perimeter fence cannot function as a
secondary containment system. The porcupine enclosure must be completely surrounded by a perimeter fence not less
than 6 feet in height. Correct by May 31, 2024.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The licensee has not developed and documented an environmental enhancement plan to promote the psychological well-
being of the birds housed at the facility. Lack of an environmental enhancement plan does not ensure that adequate and
appropriate measures to promote the psychological well-being of the birds are being provided. The licensee must
develop, document and follow an environmental enhancement plan that promotes the psychological well-being of the
birds. The plan must also be approved by the Attending Veterinarian. Correct by April 1, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
n

narrative:
3.127(d) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
There is a 6 foot perimeter fence around the porcupine enclosure except for the area of the gate. The existing gate is less 
than 6 feet in height. Lack of a complete 6 foot high perimeter fence does not prevent unauthorized people or unwanted 
animals from having access to the animals housed within. Also lack of a complete perimeter fence cannot function as a 
secondary containment system. The porcupine enclosure must be completely surrounded by a perimeter fence not less 
than 6 feet in height. Correct by May 31, 2024. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The licensee has not developed and documented an environmental enhancement plan to promote the psychological well- 
being of the birds housed at the facility. Lack of an environmental enhancement plan does not ensure that adequate and 
appropriate measures to promote the psychological well-being of the birds are being provided. The licensee must 
develop, document and follow an environmental enhancement plan that promotes the psychological well-being of the 
birds. The plan must also be approved by the Attending Veterinarian. Correct by April 1, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
